data.text:
With the #COVID19 pandemic placing so many of the world’s children in jeopardy, I appeal to leaders at all levels: protect our children and safeguard their well-being.

-- @antonioguterres https://t.co/zjS0W8q2xq https://t.co/KkPimosuzq

Following restrictions on air traffic introduced by countries to contain the spread of #COVID19, @ICAO calls on authorities to grant speedy authorization & access for repatriation flights. https://t.co/e9gnx0F2F9 https://t.co/BM6MT4sJgG

“Under international law, everyone has the right to return to their home country – even during a pandemic.”

-- @UNHumanRights Chief @mbachelet urges countries in Latin America & around the world to open borders to people stranded abroad amid #COVID19. https://t.co/rahPq8NJhP https://t.co/9qEV9TWfyK

🏥 Health workers
🔬 Scientists
💙 Volunteers
Refugees are playing many different roles, showing solidarity & supporting the global #COVID19 response. https://t.co/fqDpbbAD2c via @Refugees 

 https://t.co/9xIVAzFG0j

130+ countries are now supporting @antonioguterres' appeal to address gender-based violence amid #COVID19. They have committed to making it a key part of #coronavirus response plans and are calling for zero tolerance for violence at home. https://t.co/BWKqB2ztsM

To help contain the spread of #COVID19 in India, @WHO has deployed its polio surveillance team to help communities with surveillance, contact tracing & containment. https://t.co/yFYdZUXyQt https://t.co/NotPK2d3dA

Amid the #COVID19 pandemic, @UNFPA has delivered infection-control supplies to maternal health facilities in Viet Nam to help protect staff & ensure women & newborns can get the services they need.

https://t.co/vRSiYB8kK7 https://t.co/My5kP2s6H3

As Yemen faces threat of #COVID19, lack of funding will soon disrupt vital services for millions, including food, treatment for malnourished children, vaccines, shelter & more. 

@UNOCHA is calling for support from donors to continue its life-saving work. https://t.co/cVjzxlVwOh https://t.co/OfAQYSmsTm

As #COVID19 continues to spread around the world, the UN is working to reduce its negative impact on children facing new health risks, disruptions to their education & increased exposure to domestic violence & hunger.

https://t.co/rvHYf3lCtB

On Wednesday's #WorldArtDay, see how art is providing comfort to people around the world during the #COVID19 pandemic.
https://t.co/E2O53FMlNz

School closures due to #COVID19 have resulted in millions of children spending more time online, leaving them vulnerable to sexual exploitation.

@UNICEF has steps governments, parents & the tech industry can take to keep children safe online. https://t.co/GbZWlazTgh

From providing medical supplies & hygiene items, to sharing life-saving information & supporting the most vulnerable, the UN is working around the world to help tackle the #COVID19 pandemic.
https://t.co/nnly8iWO1e

“Do unto others as you would have them do unto you” - the "Golden Rule" mosaic at UNHQ, based on the painting by US artist Norman Rockwell.

Art can provide comfort in times of crisis & difficulty. More on Wednesday’s #WorldArtDay: https://t.co/cZWfi8Zq8p https://t.co/BJh9slvyvC

Decades of conflict and poverty have eroded Afghanistan's health system.

Amid the #COVID19 crisis, health workers like Dr. Nasir are doing everything they can to curb the pandemic & save lives. via @UNOCHA

https://t.co/69UrpZrPDX

Access to accurate & truthful information can save lives. 

@UNESCO is supporting media in developing countries so they can positively contribute to the fight against the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/SC4M12mxvy https://t.co/suqx8thKDO

Despite the threat of #COVID19, the women & men #ServingForPeace with @UNPeacekeeping continue their vital work, while supporting countries with their #coronavirus response. 

https://t.co/X6dZVVYqIH

Now is not the time to reduce the resources for the operations of @WHO or any other humanitarian organization in the fight against #COVID19.

-- @antonioguterres. Full statement: https://t.co/CmToWwh2wq https://t.co/Um7bJRgz0Q

First UN solidarity flight took off Tuesday with vital medical supplies for African nations.

@WFP is helping @WHO deliver masks, thermometers, ventilators & more, to help contain spread of #COVID19 in Africa. https://t.co/rj9JayE3Rx  https://t.co/0w1CbgTnXL

#COVID19 pandemic expected to have dramatic impact on economic activity in 2020. Global economic downturn could exceed that of 2008–09 financial crisis. 

Get details on the World Economic Outlook from @IMFNews.  https://t.co/cf6jmVmobO https://t.co/VIrTZiwiEc

"This is a time for science and solidarity."

-- @antonioguterres stresses the need for trust in science & institutions, and solidarity with each other, as the world takes on #COVID19. https://t.co/rJIjEjotBC https://t.co/ia1jrK27I2

The #coronavirus crisis has led to a rise of harmful stereotypes. Preventing stigma is important in the fight against #COVID19. 

Be kind and spread compassion. https://t.co/3EHAHiVpp3 https://t.co/AMtQLE45PL

From lost jobs to social isolation, #COVID19 has a profound affect on people's lives around the world. 

Share your experiences and coping mechanisms with the #coronavirus crisis in this survey: https://t.co/bEw8oHJFlH via @UNUWIDER https://t.co/ggNNMEPZ5s

In their ongoing efforts to protect local communities against #COVID19, @UNIFIL_ donated protective gear & other necessary supplies to help contain #coronavirus in Lebanon. https://t.co/dYSvy8fuSW via @UNPeacekeeping https://t.co/O5cF4xqh9V

Chagas, a neglected tropical disease, is caused by parasites carried by "kissing bugs" and affects 6 - 7 million people, mostly in Latin America. 

It is curable if treatment is initiated soon after infection. 

More on Tuesday's 1st-ever #WorldChagasDay: https://t.co/4MvxSoIkfC https://t.co/wzLHiD14Gw

From refugees sewing masks for healthcare workers to #MusicForHope, acts of solidarity and kindness are spreading amid the #COVID19 pandemic.
https://t.co/bafj85K5OR

Concerns are rising about how quarantine regulations & movement restrictions due to #COVID19 could impact food security, particularly in developing world.

The UN calls on countries to keep trade routes & supply chains open to help maintain food supplies.

https://t.co/4QR3n9zB2N

UN Middle East envoys call for greater efforts toward ceasefire, as region grapples with spread of #coronavirus and concerns about social, economic & political impacts of #COVID19 grow.
https://t.co/ov70WIHiQb

From Argentina to Zambia, the UN is working around the world to help countries address the #COVID19 pandemic. Here are just some of the ways we are helping: https://t.co/SbDMHReUCP https://t.co/lG6jGXSFYl

Hundreds of thousands of children who are detained in countries around the world are at grave risk of contracting #COVID19.

@UNICEF says the rights of detained children must be protected and stresses the need for their safe release. https://t.co/4f4wC7FLJF https://t.co/Wymldk0JkS

Coronaviruses, such as #COVID19, are zoonotic, meaning they are transmitted from animals to humans. They threaten the well-being of humans, animals and ecosystems.

@UNEP explains how addressing threats to nature can help prevent zoonoses. https://t.co/crwT83Oba0 https://t.co/IlWxOYEpt8

Maintaining a daily structure

Managing bad behaviour

Talking about #COVID19

Some parenting tips in the time of #coronavirus from @UNICEF: https://t.co/lWrXasUWC2

Despite the threat posed by #COVID19, @WFP_UNHAS is continuing its vital work to deliver essential assistance to some of the world's most vulnerable people.

https://t.co/evC3VGP8WU

☑️ Keep physical distance
☑️ Avoid handshaking 
☑️ Stay home

These are some of the tips from @WFP Storyteller Malish to stay healthy amid #COVID19. https://t.co/U2gtyZ4W0M https://t.co/pGniKC8hq9

People all over the 🌎 can get real-time, accurate information about #COVID19 directly from @WHO through @Whatsapp. 

Here's how: https://t.co/Usb6myHkeC https://t.co/iqrCEVzUnY

🍘🍏 Snack healthy 
🍦 🍭 Avoid processed foods 
👨‍👩‍👧‍👦 Cook and eat together 

More tips from @UNICEF on how families can stay healthy at home during the #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/mV2HgayEda

Now is the time for unity, for the int'l community to work together in solidarity to stop this virus & its shattering consequences. 

- @antonioguterres on the critical role of @WHO in the fight against #COVID19. Full statement: https://t.co/LClPwA8y38 https://t.co/Lb3BhmRg31

Women who are pregnant 🤰🏼🤰🏾, can protect themselves against #COVID19 by:

✔️ Frequently washing hands with soap & water
✔️ Maintaining physical distance from others
✔️ Avoiding touching one's face

More tips from @WHO: https://t.co/iwmCea0AfM https://t.co/GN3kS71S4b

As many businesses & governments have moved their operations & services online due to the #COVID19 pandemic, @UNCTAD warns #coronavirus crisis may further deepen digital divide faced by people in least developed countries. https://t.co/ZbigOEys5k https://t.co/dhwCrHfOGe

🤿 Fancy a virtual dive in the ocean 🐠? 

As many are forced to stay at home because of #COVID19, @UNEP is sharing online resources to learn more about coral reefs and oceans. 

https://t.co/8pkuccfkC7

Right now, nurses, midwives & other healthcare workers around the world are risking their wellbeing to care for us all. 

We thank them for looking after us, even in the hardest of times. https://t.co/2mqJ5YJfYB #COVID19 https://t.co/IISFMBWw6b

📱 Stepping in when friends share misinformation 
✋ Calling out discrimination 
👶 Helping siblings learn from home 
🧼Teaching someone how to wash hands properly

Here's how young people are stepping up to fight #COVID19: https://t.co/rXrZZR6DhX https://t.co/FkUplcn540

Around the world, people & communities are coming together in an inspirational display of unity in the face of #COVID19.

Check out this @Twitter moment to see great examples of solidarity in the face of crisis. https://t.co/zN0MIK1eQT

Many women under lockdown for #COVID19 face violence where they should be safest: in their own homes.

I urge all governments to put women’s safety first as they respond to the pandemic.

-- @antonioguterres https://t.co/Ht3W9nPWYz #coronavirus https://t.co/Ohw8F7hLav

Great apes are potentially vulnerable to #COVID19.

@UNESCO is following the developing situation and working to protect endangered ape species & their habitats. https://t.co/a94NNshwr2 https://t.co/5nLt3xrci3

40% of the world's population doesn't have soap and running water at home - essential in the fight against #COVID19. 

@UNDP is investing in access to safe & affordable drinking water for all: https://t.co/tRWnmxg2ZL https://t.co/IgaFEzyXAD

Misinformation during a crisis like #COVID19 can result in people being left uninformed, unprotected & vulnerable.

Play @Freerice's #coronavirus game to check if you have the facts needed to protect yourself and those around you. 
https://t.co/azFEKLrV4w via @WFP https://t.co/xhiV6JdZFs

We hope our followers who celebrate #Easter find a way to safely mark the occasion even at this difficult time. 

Together, people of all faiths can and will defeat #COVID19 – with cooperation, solidarity, and belief in our common humanity. https://t.co/oFDdnpen93

Many children need extra support to cope with the changes brought on by #COVID19.

A new storybook produced in collaboration with 50 organizations, including the UN, aims to help children adapt to a new & rapidly changing reality due to #coronavirus. 

https://t.co/BBDyRPLJ8F

🤸‍ Try online exercise classes 
💃 Dance to music
🤾 Skip rope

@WHO has more tips on how to #BeActive and stay #HealthyAtHome during the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/AWTKsSXufd https://t.co/3Wn7biAgO4

People with autism must continue to have access to the support systems required to remain in their homes & communities through times of crisis, instead of facing the prospect of forced institutionalization. 

-- @antonioguterres https://t.co/9VIsDiVmHX #AutismAwareness https://t.co/FlzRSfTFII

As concerns about the protection of human rights amid #COVID19 grow, the UN is calling on countries to ensure the rights of all people are at the heart of the global response to the #coronavirus crisis.

https://t.co/NHwiZJMby5

"We call on all of humanity to take inspiration from the acts of solidarity, cooperation & kindness to support the vulnerable among us."

UN Messengers of Peace show support for @antonioguterres' global ceasefire appeal amid #COVID19: https://t.co/o5IMalI53E https://t.co/EC6XpKBnjM

"Without urgent action, this health crisis risks becoming a child rights crisis. Only by working together can we keep millions of girls & boys healthy, safe & learning," warns @unicefchief amid #COVID19 pandemic. #ForEveryChild
https://t.co/eUZi9TMBlL

Health care workers wear protective masks in a medical centre supported by @UNRWA in Lebanon.

From improving health services to creating new distance-learning options, UNRWA is supporting Palestine refugees during the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/NYWo8OOxTb https://t.co/eI1KcagYy2

The #COVID19 pandemic comes with particular challenges for the most vulnerable, including people with disabilities. 

@WHO shares tips on how to ensure everyone receives the care they need during the #coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/ADPlKYjcgz https://t.co/megsHwMhIr

In an act of solidarity amid the #coronavirus crisis, @iaeaorg has provided specialized testing equipment & protective gear to dozens of countries, with more support for the #COVID19 response on the way. https://t.co/wxMbHmWAj2 https://t.co/iDDHB0YPtC

This is the fight of a generation - and the raison d’être of the UN itself.
To prevail against the pandemic, we will need to work together.
-@antonioguterres to UN Security Council on #COVID19. https://t.co/BF8jNVCdbH

New #Fin4Dev report looks at how financial systems can help increase the sustainability of the private sector and improve economic outlook in the wake of #COVID19. https://t.co/NqylSwWyPT #GlobalGoals https://t.co/I0QTene5jj

"This is a colossal test of leadership. It demands decisive, coordinated and innovative action from all, and for all."

-- @UNHumanRights Chief @mbachelet calls for a more cooperative, global & human rights-based approach to #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/nQEmTPlaem https://t.co/sgo4NR4d9e
Venezuela: UN supplies arrive in the country to support #COVID19 response: https://t.co/gQ7Wp1eLMv via @UNOCHA https://t.co/ppG6lwaIIP

The UN Staff Union in NYC made a special delivery of donated items to a local hospital this week to support health workers and families affected by #COVID19.

More on how the UN is helping to tackle #coronavirus around the world: https://t.co/TufWEw7UcC https://t.co/xCu8qNMIk8

#COVID19 is threatening millions of people at risk of food insecurity & malnutrition.

Despite the #coronavirus crisis, @WFP continues working around the clock to provide food-assistance to 87 million people around the world. 📸 ⬇️ 

https://t.co/6h6fLrzToN

The #COVID19 crisis puts children at greater risk of experiencing violence & exploitation, and mental health challenges. 

@UNHumanRights experts call for boosting child protection measures to help safeguard millions of children worldwide. https://t.co/JuAWNMWwuc https://t.co/Aj7zS7vsmA

Refugees and displaced people are among the most vulnerable to the spread of #COVID19.  @Refugees is supporting prevention measures among these populations in East Africa by:

🗣️ Raising awareness
🏘️ Reducing overcrowding 
🧼 Distributing soap 

More: https://t.co/CNOcpfQ6ZT https://t.co/NexpKGvnz9

The UN is fully mobilized in support of communities & countries fighting #COVID19. 

Check out this @Twitter moment to see how the UN is making a difference. https://t.co/73iZyRInMm

With the #coronavirus pandemic threatening conflict-affected countries in the Middle East, the UN is working to stop #COVID19 and prevent further suffering. 

https://t.co/5yXL6jXvzA

Now is the time for unity, for the int'l community to work together in solidarity to stop this virus & its shattering consequences. 

- @antonioguterres on the critical role of @WHO in the fight against #COVID19. Full statement: https://t.co/LClPwA8y38 https://t.co/22i0SPfCfZ

As the #Ebola outbreak in the Democratic Republic of Congo comes to an end, meet health care worker Nurse Espérance and hear about her lifesaving work on the frontlines of the Ebola response. https://t.co/na0Tq6HWae https://t.co/K1eHZ6SF1S

Refugees and displaced people are among the most vulnerable to the spread of #COVID19.

Racial equality must be at the heart of the #COVID19 response.

🍦 🍭 Avoid processed foods

As #COVID19 poses serious new challenges to human well-being, the UN is bringing people and ideas together to find innovative solutions to the #coronavirus threat.
https://t.co/DnXr3ZD1Zr

Mali: Security Council hears about efforts underway by @UNPeacekeeping mission in the country to carry out its essential work, while also helping to prevent spread of #COVID19. https://t.co/m22fLAb9KV
On Tuesday's #WorldHealthDay, we said THANK YOU to nurses, midwives and all health workers on the frontlines of the #COVID19 response for their hard work & sacrifice. https://t.co/BsB0LhfOOS

Women make up the majority of the health and social workforce, performing superhero tasks every day.

On #WorldHealthDay and every day, we give thanks to them all. https://t.co/2mqJ5YJfYB #COVID19 https://t.co/2UGvnol3D1
https://t.co/55wUdveChN
https://t.co/JrgB7cZJAD

“Genocide is a process. The genocide against the Tutsi in Rwanda started with hate speech. The Holocaust did not start with the gas chambers - it started with hate speech.”

-@UN_GP_RtoP's Adama Dieng on the dangers of hate speech and intolerance. #kiwbuka https://t.co/0jhKNdbJld

Nurses & midwives play a key role in caring for people everywhere, especially during the current #COVID19 pandemic. Investing in nursing & midwivery benefits everyone. 

Tuesday is #WorldHealthDay. https://t.co/Kp4tY0MX5B #SurpportNursesAndMidwives https://t.co/dP06ZM1Qx3

"It takes courage to forgive."

Survivor Alphonse Kabalisa reflects on the meaning of unity & reconciliation -- and finding the courage to forgive perpetrators of the 1994 genocide against the Tutsi in Rwanda. #Kwibuka https://t.co/Tmt4GWvCe6

Nurses & midwives make up the largest group of healthcare workers in the world - and they are on the frontlines of the #COVID19 response. 

Show solidarity and #SupportNursesAndMidwives on Tuesday's #WorldHealthDay & every day. https://t.co/Kp4tY14yub https://t.co/sCfPjEg9wD

26 years after the genocide against the Tutsi in Rwanda, see the faces and hear the stories of survivors on Tuesday's International Day of Reflection. https://t.co/x0tUxsfhjq #Kwibuka https://t.co/XRavlZwP1N

Syria: Warring parties failed to abide by international law by attacking hospitals and other civilian facilities, @antonioguterres tells Security Council. 

Civilians are #NotATarget. 

https://t.co/eAMU15DJ36

https://t.co/RTrayiYjbA
